creditline: Gift of the Clark Center for Japanese Art & Culture; formerly given to the Center by H. Ed Robison, in memory of his beloved wife Ulrike Pietzner Robison
description: red shrine with blooming cherry tree; woman in green kimono with child in red kimono in foreground feeding birds with other figures in middle ground
marks: left: 昭和十五年作　晝の東京　日枝神社 {Shōwa jūgonen saku, [???? LRC: 遠志 {Tōshi}
medium: Woodblock print; ink and color on paper
title: Hie Jinja
